item.title: Booting Up The Cash Register
item.description: Today in Tedium: The modern computer store, as I’ve argued in the past, is a bit of a mess. Itâ€™s all about the hard sell (in a gigantic box) at the cost of any personality whatsoever. It was so bad that Apple (and later, Microsoft) had to create its own self-branded stores to ensure their products were seen in the proper light. This is kind of painful, of course, because personal computers were really the domain of the hobbyist at first.
